content:
Here are ten more weeks of training that you can follow to continue your journey from white belt to blue belt in Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu (BJJ):

7. Week 7: Mount position
* In this week, focus on mastering the mount position, where you are on top of your opponent with your body aligned over theirs.
* Practice using the mount to maintain the position and prevent your opponent from escaping.
* Work on attacking from the mount with submissions, such as the arm triangle and armbar.
8. Week 8: Back control
* Spend this week learning and improving your back control, where you have both hooks in and your body aligned behind your opponent's.
* Practice using the back control to maintain the position and prevent your opponent from escaping.
* Work on attacking from the back control with submissions, such as the rear-naked choke and bow and arrow choke.
9. Week 9: Takedowns
* In this week, focus on mastering the fundamentals of takedowns in BJJ.
* Practice executing common takedowns, such as the single leg takedown and double leg takedown.
* Work on defending against takedowns and returning to the guard position.
10. Week 10: Passes
* Spend this week focusing on improving your passing game in BJJ.
* Practice executing common guard passes, such as the knee slice pass and the over-under pass.
* Work on defending against guard passes and returning to the guard position.
11. Week 11: Submissions
* In this week, focus on mastering a variety of submissions in BJJ.
* Practice executing common submissions, such as the armbar, triangle choke, and kimura.
* Work on improving your defense against submissions and escaping from bad positions.
12. Week 12: Transitions
* Spend this week focusing on improving your ability to smoothly transition between different positions in BJJ.
* Practice transitioning from the guard to the mount, back control, and other dominant positions.
* Work on defending against transitions and returning to the guard position.
13. Week 13: Drilling
* In this week, focus on drilling the techniques and movements you have learned in BJJ.
* Practice executing the techniques in a repetitive and controlled manner to improve muscle memory and efficiency.
* Work on integrating the techniques into live sparring and rolling with a partner.
14. Week 14: Sparring
* Spend this week focusing on live sparring and rolling with a partner in BJJ.
* Practice executing the techniques you have learned against a resisting opponent.
* Work on maintaining a good pace and using strategy to outmaneuver your opponent.
15. Week 15: Conditioning
* In this final week, focus on improving your overall physical conditioning for BJJ.
* Practice a variety of exercises, such as push-ups, burpees, and jumping jacks, to improve your strength, endurance, and agility.
* Work on maintaining a healthy diet and getting sufficient rest to support your training.

Remember to always warm up before training, and to listen to your body and take regular breaks to avoid injury. Also, be sure to continue learning and improving your skills and techniques in BJJ, and enjoy the journey of growth and self-improvement.
